Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Caerin 1.9 (XXA, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals; ZZHa)

Literature Information.Literature: Activity: Activity against M. luteus (MIC 12 ug/ml), S. aureus or MRSA (MIC 12 ug/ml), L. innocua (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. epidermidis (MIC 25 ug/ml), S. uberis (MIC 25 ug/ml) and B. cereus (MIC 50 ug/ml).  Also A. baumannii, antibiofilm:S. aureus and A. bumannii This peptide could inhibit HIV infection with little adverse effect on T cells (J Virol 2005; 79:11598-11606).MOA:virus: it appears to inhibit viral entry.Structure: By similarity, it contains two amphipathic helices separated by a region of less-defined helicity and greater flexibility.Animal model:mouse: significantly inhibit the growth of methicillin-resistant S. aureus (MRSA) strains in a murine skin infection model.Updated 4/2019; 10/2023 CW; 8/2024 formatted GW
Literature Information.Author: Steinborner ST, Currie GJ, Bowie JH, Wallace JC, Tyler MJ.1998, Australia
Literature Information.Title: New antibiotic caerin 1 peptides from the skin secretion of the Australian tree frog Litoria chloris. Comparison of the activities of the caerin 1 peptides from the genus Litoria.
